intro: Silene gillettii, commonly known as Gillett's campion, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or white flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in areas with well-drained soil. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Silene gillettii is an herbaceous perennial that thrives in full sun and is adapted to dry, arid environments.
